newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: BANK OF KOREA TO SUPPLY 800 BLN WON VIA REPOS.
newsitem.headline: BANK OF KOREA TO SUPPLY 800 BLN WON VIA REPOS.

text.p: South Korea's central Bank of Korea said it would supply 800 billion won to banks on Wednesday through 10-day repurchase agreements to ease tight liquidity.
"We have decided to supply 800 billion won as interest rates seem to be rising on tight liquidity," said a central bank official.
"We hope this will ease the cash shortage until the next central bank deadline for won reserves," he said. The won reserve deadline for banks lands twice a month on the 7th and 22nd.
Short-term liquidity had dried up as financial institutions had to pay back 1.5 trillion won in loans they owed to the government on Tuesday, money market dealers said.
